data.title: Quadrilateral Area
data.statement:
A quadrilateral is a 4-sided figure in a plane. Given a quadrilateral, find its area. The quadrilateral will be specified by its 4 vertex points in clockwise order around the polygon.

Hint: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoelace_formula
data.constraints:
[[x]] and [[y]] will be integers in the Cartesian plane
-1000 < [[x]],[[y]] < 1000

The polygon will always be simple (no crossing edges) and have positive area.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A quadrilateral is a 4-sided figure in a plane. Given a quadrilateral, find its area. The quadrilateral will be specified by its 4 vertex points in clockwise order around the polygon.

Hint: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoelace_formula
Input
Four lines of space-separated integers x and y representing the coordinates of the four (x, y) points.
Output
A number representing the value of the area of the corresponding quadrilateral rounded to 1 decimal place.
Constraints
x and y will be integers in the Cartesian plane
-1000 < x,y < 1000

The polygon will always be simple (no crossing edges) and have positive area.
Example
Input
-2 0
-2 4
3 4
3 0
Output
20.0
